tags: im tired of them ruining this story
these characters are being butchered on screen
summary: People who say that jon is a “Targaryen” or even a “stark” are completely ignoring his story arc. The whole point is that Jon...
body: People who say that jon is a “Targaryen” or even a “stark” are completely ignoring his story arc. The whole point is that Jon realizes that he doesn’t need a family name to be worthy. It’s his actions that make him who he is not his parentage. It’s actually a really compelling narrative that is being completely overlooked in the show (because for some reason they love a good nasty incest plot) and also by people in the fandom. By ignoring this his character is being reduced significantly into just another pawn in the game of thrones. The point of Jon, dany, and Tyrion are that they don’t fit into this world as they’re “supposed to.” It’s just really frustrating that people are turning Jon, who is actually a very interesting and relatable character, into someone so dull and redundant. Jon as a character deserves much more than that. He is not jon stark or Jon Targaryen (or god forbid aegon) he is Jon Snow.

By ignoring this his character is being reduced significantly into just another pawn in the game of thrones. It’s actually a really compelling narrative that is being completely overlooked in the show (because for some reason they love a good nasty incest plot) and also by people in the fandom. By ignoring this his character is being reduced significantly into just another pawn in the game of thrones. The point of Jon, dany, and Tyrion are that they don’t fit into this world as they’re “supposed to.” It’s just really frustrating that people are turning Jon, who is actually a very interesting and relatable character, into someone so dull and redundant. Jon as a character deserves much more than that. He is not jon stark or Jon Targaryen (or god forbid aegon) he is Jon Snow.

It’s his actions that make him who he is not his parentage. It’s actually a really compelling narrative that is being completely overlooked in the show (because for some reason they love a good nasty incest plot) and also by people in the fandom. By ignoring this his character is being reduced significantly into just another pawn in the game of thrones. The point of Jon, dany, and Tyrion are that they don’t fit into this world as they’re “supposed to.” It’s just really frustrating that people are turning Jon, who is actually a very interesting and relatable character, into someone so dull and redundant. Jon as a character deserves much more than that. He is not jon stark or Jon Targaryen (or god forbid aegon) he is Jon Snow.

All photos are mine ©, unless stated otherwise (i.e. an edit) or reblogged because of the feels.

summary: Just looked at my email and saw a bunch of lovely comments from you - thanks so much! made my day!
question: Just looked at my email and saw a bunch of lovely comments from you - thanks so much! made my day!
answer:
I am STILL up thinking about this fic! You’ve gutted me! I’m afraid to look at the timestamps from my first comment to my last comment that shows how obsessed I was to finish this in one sitting. I most definitely stand by my last comment, especially about how you brought to life the fan speculations on Bran’s POV in A Game Of Thrones.

You’re welcome and TRULY THANK YOU for writing this!

If anyone seeing this loves a well-written, on point characterization, angst with a side of crime drama, modern AU then please click this link and get lost (I say affectionately!).

summary: Hello, Do you think that Jon could end up as a Gaemon Pale Hair type if Elia was Regent? Gaemon may have or may have not been...
question: Hello, Do you think that Jon could end up as a Gaemon Pale Hair type if Elia was Regent? Gaemon may have or may have not been Aegon's son but he lacked a strong maternal family that could protect him. While I doubt Elia would be petty enough to make Jon a whipping boy I think Oberyn might be. He may be a popular character who loves Elia but he is also not a nice man. I could also see him poisoning Jon and framing someone with trying to kill Aegon. What Elia endured is a strong motive. Thanks.
answer:
No.

Because the Martells are above pointless stupid cruelty, having Jon at court is counterproductive to anything Elia would want to hope to achieve. You don’t making a whipping boy out of the nephew of the Warden of the North, bastard he might be.

Jon Snow, while a serious succession threat, also has equal value as a hostage, much like Rhaenys or Viserys naturally would be. The entire purpose of peace during an Aegon regency would to bandage the wounds left by the Targaryens.

Oberyn would not poison Jon Snow because it hamstrung the healing and might actually /harm/ his family. Beyond a debate over his morality, Oberyn Martell is not a fool, to lash out at a child when there other means available.

Beyond the dire effects of having the Red Viper in the vicinity of the dragon prince’s bastard (is Oberyn going to murder the charge of Lord Dayne under his roof after taking bread and salt? Kill the boy while visiting Winterfell? What happens if the kid gets a cold and rumors run right into war?)- Jon Snow would be neutralized. Anyway.

Faith. The Wall. And right where Destiny needs him.

summary: This is the moment I knew I would love Jon Snow long time.  What. A. Badass.  He’s gon’ die. He knows he’s gon’ die. And he’s...
caption:
This is the moment I knew I would love Jon Snow long time.


What. A. Badass.


He’s gon’ die. He knows he’s gon’ die. And he’s like, “You know what? I’m gon’ die but I’m gon’ take all y’all bitches out with me!”


He has run out of fucks to give.


I love you, Jon Snow. I love you forever!


Now never do anything this stupid again. Oh Wait.

I can't believe I missed this while writing my post about Sansa and Dragonflies...
summary: So I wrote about Sansa connections with the tale/song of Jenny of Oldstones and her Prince of Dragonflies, Duncan...
body:
So I wrote about Sansa connections with the tale/song of Jenny of Oldstones and her Prince of Dragonflies, Duncan Targaryen, here.

We are not sure if Jenny had red hair, but it is very likely and is heavily implied in these videos: [x] [x]    

But we do know that Prince Duncan Targaryen had brown hair, thanks to The World of Ice and Fire:

So Jenny and Duncan are a ‘redhead’ girl of the Riverlands with a Targaryen Prince with brown hair…

Sounds familiar???

summary: I love this scene, so hard.  It is probably in my top 5 of the entire series of Game of Thrones.  Maester Aemon, for one thing,...
caption:
I love this scene, so hard.  It is probably in my top 5 of the entire series of Game of Thrones.


Maester Aemon, for one thing, is the OG. He’s so badass, he died of old age. In Westeros. At The Wall. For another, he gives Jonaegon a kick in the ass several times, when he needs it.  But this scene, especially in the context of what we now know of Jon, is chilling, it’s sad, it’s bittersweet, and those words….Love is the death of Duty….those words are going to come back around in Season 8, I have no doubt.

The scene makes me sad for both of them, sad that they were family but didn’t know it (well, I suppose you could argue that Aemon had an inkling, but he never revealed it).

THIS is peak TV. I miss Maester Aemon.  So little screen time, so much impact.

blog.name: jackoshadows
blog.title: Jak O' the Shadows
blog.description: I’m not going to swear an oath I can’t uphold. Talk about my father if you want. Tell me that’s the attitude that got him killed. But when enough people make false promises, words stop meaning anything. Then there are no more answers - only better and better lies. And lies won’t help us in this fight - Jon Snow.

tags: trying to understand the Jonsa nonsense...
summary: One thing that has always confused me about Jonsa is that their ship is also going to lead to a Targaryen restoration? Like, by...
body:
One thing that has always confused me about Jonsa is that their ship is also going to lead to a Targaryen restoration? Like, by the end of the series Jon will be a full blown Targaryen. He would be a legitimate Targaryen in Westeros and not a bastard called Snow. His children would be little Targaryens.

His mother was Lyanna Stark and his father was Rhaegar Targaryen and they loved each other and were married. Any child Aegon Targaryen has is going to be a Targaryen in Westeros.

So how does that fit in with their ‘NORTHERN INDEPENDENCE’ and ‘IT’S ALL ABOUT THE STARKS’  5 page metas? If Jonsa happens, Sansa’s children would also be Targaryen, right? Am I missing something here?

summary: Why is Bowen Marsh crying as he stabs Jon? Is he simply terrified of the drastic measure he has taken and of the possible...
question: Why is Bowen Marsh crying as he stabs Jon? Is he simply terrified of the drastic measure he has taken and of the possible consequences or do you think he feels some genuine guilt for the murder of Jon?

blog.name: turtle-paced

summary: Settle a debate: Could/should Ned have petitioned Robert to legitimize Jon? That makes him part of the family but probably puts...
question: Settle a debate: Could/should Ned have petitioned Robert to legitimize Jon? That makes him part of the family but probably puts more pressure on Ned to name the mother. I think Ned was right not to do so but a friend points out that by making him a Stark, you tell everyone that he's part of the family so anyone that might have harbored doubts about his parentage would stop.
answer:
No. Legitimising Jon is a terrible idea for Ned on multiple levels. 

As you’ve pointed out, it invites more scrutiny as to Jon’s origins - from Robert, on a personal level, if nothing else - and Ned absolutely 100% does not want to discuss Jon with Robert or have Robert asking about Jon. On top of that, passing Jon off as his own bastard is a sound lie. It’s juicy enough gossip that people want to believe it. Etiquette keeps most people from asking more questions of Ned, which means he doesn’t have to embroider the lie and reveal potential holes in his story. It’s a nice, simple, eminently believable story.

Meanwhile, legitimising Jon would trash Ned’s relationship with Catelyn. Aside from the personal ramifications, the two of them being in love and all, Catelyn’s the Lady of Winterfell and a daughter of House Tully. Catelyn has a role to play in the running of Winterfell and, by extension, the North. Having Jon in Winterfell is already humiliating enough for Catelyn; legitimising him is exponentially worse for her, and a bright red flag that Jon is a threat to her children. It’s a relationship-ending move.  If Ned legitimised Jon, he’s forgoing the vast majority of the emotional, political, and administrative support Catelyn provided him, and it would cost him cordial relationships with the Tullys as well. 

This also has the potential to affect Ned’s relationship with his own children. As much as the legitimate Starklings love Ned and Jon, they love their mother, too - how are they going to react to their dad publicly humiliating her to this degree? Legitimising Jon could break the family in two. Again, with possible political ramifications.

Legitimising Jon would ease some of the prejudice against him and make his social life more comfortable. Unfortunately, the negative effects of legitimising him outweigh this benefit by a long way.

blog.name: incorrect-got-quotes
blog.title: Dead, almost like my interest in the show
blog.description: I post quotes when I feel like it. Mostly nowadays I don’t.If you want to use one of the quotes as a story or drawing prompt, I'm fine with that, as long as you credit me in your story or art. Also, tag any drawings under #oberyn’s saucy art. Yes, I am in fact Oberyn Martell. For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary: Jon: For Halloween I’m going to wear a trashbag, and when people are like, “Oh, you’re going as trash, haha,” I’ll be like,...
body: Jon: For Halloween I’m going to wear a trashbag, and when people are like, “Oh, you’re going as trash, haha,” I’ll be like, “Close, I’m going as my biological father.”

reblog.comment: Jon: For Halloween I’m going to wear a trashbag, and when people are like, “Oh, you’re going as trash, haha,” I’ll be like, “Close, I’m going as my biological father.”
